title: NASA’s Webb, Curiosity Named in TIME’s Best Inventions Hall of Fame
summary: Two icons of discovery, NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope and NASA’s Curiosity rover, have earned places in TIME’s “Best Inventions Hall of Fame,” which recognizes the 25 groundbreaking inventions of the past quarter century that have had the most global impact, since TIME began its annual Best Inventions list in 2000. The inventions are celebrated […]

title: Study: Current, future megaconstellations risk space-based astronomy
summary: Researchers from NASA’s Ames Research Center sound alarm about current and projected impacts to observatories, like the Hubble Space Telescope and others.

title: China plans 2026 debut of new rocket for crewed lunar and LEO missions
summary:
China is building towards a debut Long March 10 rocket launch in what will be a major test for the country’s crewed lunar landing plans.
The post China plans 2026 debut of new rocket for crewed lunar and LEO missions appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: A Rare Gourd
summary: NASA’s Hubble Space Telescope captured an uncommon sight – the death of a low-mass star – in this image of the Calabash Nebula released on Feb. 3, 2017. Here, we can see the star going through a rapid transformation from a red giant to a planetary nebula, during which it blows its outer layers of […]

title: Space Force Association unveils virtual ‘National Spacepower Center’ for education and wargaming
summary:
The initiative aims to educate policy makers on space as a warfighting domain

title: NASA Announces Plan to Map Milky Way With Roman Space Telescope
summary: NASA’s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope team has released detailed plans for a major survey that will reveal our home galaxy, the Milky Way, in unprecedented detail. In one month of observations spread across two years, the survey will unveil tens of billions of stars and explore previously uncharted structures. “The Galactic Plane Survey will […]

title: XMM-Newton sees comet 3I/ATLAS in X-ray light
Pablo Álvarez Fernández | Spacesuits, Survival & Spacewalk Dreams | ESA Explores #18
summary: Step inside astronaut training with ESA astronaut Pablo Álvarez Fernández as he shares his training journey from Cologne in Germany to Houston in the US. Discover what it’s like to wear a 145 kg spacesuit underwater, train for emergencies like fires and ammonia leaks and prepare for the ultimate astronaut dream: a spacewalk. Plus, Pablo talks about life in Houston, teamwork under pressure and what’s next on his path to the stars.

title: The European space industry’s big merger: lessons for emerging space nations
summary:
The Oct. 23 announcement that Airbus, Thales and Leonardo will merge their satellite operations was a historic development for the European space industry. The plan aims to establish a new combined entity by 2027. Historically, the European space industry has been a competent but fragmented market in the form of national champions and competing initiatives. […]
The post The European space industry’s big merger: lessons for emerging space nations appeared first on SpaceNews.
